intro: Galeopsis rivas-martinezii, commonly known as the Rivas mint, is a species of flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically blue to purple in color, arranged in whorled clusters, and bloom during the summer months. Galeopsis rivas-martinezii is a relatively rare species, often found in rocky or disturbed habitats.
